page.title: 12Caring Services - Sth.Oakley
page.content:
Until the 1950's{East Oakley Village {Hall}was used as the local venue for the{County Library.}The books were stored in large boxes which were exchanged every three months. This service was run by village volunteers. Now there are two{library vans}serving the village. One stops for two hours on alternate Tuesdays, outside the village hall and is used mainly by old folk from Petersfield.
A{Community Care Group,}the brain child of Revd.{John Litton,}Parish Rector, has developed during the last ten years. It is operated by volunteers who provide services such as: transport for the old or infirm, visiting house bound people, looking after children during a family crisis or providing help within the community as the need arises.
